subject: english
standard: Students read a wide range of informational print and non-print texts by a wide variety of writers, including Pacific authors, to acquire new information, to respond to the needs and demands of society and the workplace, to understand how meaning is expressed in these texts, and to learn about themselves, Palau, and the world.
objective: With prompting and support, identify features of a book.
subobjective: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.
indicator: Tell where the title of the book is, the front of the book and the back of the book

subject: english
subobjective: Point to the name of the author and the illustrator of the book.
indicator: Tell how to read a book (start from top to bottom, left to right wrap around left to right)

subject: english
indicator: Point to the title of the book, the name of the author and the illustrator

subject: english
standard: Students read and analyze a wide range of literature (oral, print, visual), including literary works by Pacific authors, in many genres to build an understanding of the many dimensions (i.e., philosophical, ethical, aesthetic) of the human experience.
objective: With prompting and support recognize what a literary text is.
subobjective: Recognize that storybooks, poems, and songs are common types of literary texts.
indicator: Discuss the common types of literary texts (story books, poems, & songs)

subject: english
subobjective: Draw pictures to express elements of a story or poem (e.g., the main character, setting).
indicator: Draw pictures to express the elements of the story or poem(e.g. main character, setting)

subject: english
subobjective: Identify the elements of a story to answer the questions, who, where, and what happened.
indicator: Identify the element of a story using a story map (beginning, middle, & end)

subject: english
standard: Students use a wide variety of foundational skills that provide the basis for learning to read, and connect skills for academic study being developed in Palauan and in English.
objective: With support, demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.
subobjective: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page-by-page.
indicator: Identify and name all the upper-and lower case letters of alphabet

subject: english
subobjective: Recognize, by specific sequences of letters, that spoken words are represented by written language.
indicator: Recognize that specific sequences of letters in a spoken word are represented by written language.(e.g., the word mat is formed by letters m,a,t)

subject: english
subobjective: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.
indicator: Know that words are separated by spaces in print

subject: english
subobjective: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.
indicator: Read and follow words from left to right, top to bottom and page by page

subject: english
standard: Students acquire and use vocabulary to create, discuss, and critique texts.
objective: With support, demonstrate understanding of words and determine the meanings of common words and phrases relevant to a grade 1 topic or subject area.
subobjective: Identify new meanings for familiar words.
indicator: Demonstrate understanding of word meanings

subject: english
subobjective: Use most frequently occurring inflections (e.g., s means plural) and affixes (e.g., un means not) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.
indicator: Introduce, identify, spell, sound, name, and define, use in sentences and show pictures if available

subject: english
subobjective: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites
indicator: Use sentence strips and foldables to demonstrate understanding of occurring verbs and their opposites

subject: english
standard: Students listen and speak for socio-cultural and instructional purposes in a variety of settings, adjusting their use of spoken language to communicate clearly and present knowledge and ideas that serve different purposes and involve a variety of audiences.
objective: Listen and participate in collaborative discussions (e.g., in small and larger groups) about grade 1 topics.
subobjective: Follow cultural rules for discussion as appropriate (e.g., the oldest person in the group has the option to speak first).
indicator: Recite and follow classroom rules and routines

subject: english
subobjective: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others).
indicator: Orally sequence given instructions

subject: english
subobjective: Ask and answer questions to get information or clarify something that is not understood.
indicator: Participate in a class discussion

subject: english
indicator: Present a group presentation

subject: english
indicator: Ask open ended questions

subject: english
standard: Students listen and speak for socio-cultural and instructional purposes in a variety of settings, adjusting their use of spoken language to communicate clearly and present knowledge and ideas that serve different purposes and involve a variety of audiences.
objective: Listen and respond to oral one-step instructions or directions for a given task.
indicator: Demonstrate their understanding of the instructions by following them

subject: english
standard: Students apply knowledge of language conventions (i.e., grammar, punctuation, and spelling) and sentence structure, when writing or speaking to create, discuss, and critique texts.
objective: With support, demonstrate basic understanding of parts of speech (grammar and usage) when writing and speaking.
subobjective: Print many upper-and lowercase letters.
indicator: Write upper & lower case letters

subject: english
subobjective: Recognize frequently occurring nouns – names of persons, places, and things – in singular and plural forms.
indicator: Sound letters

subject: english
indicator: Recognize short sentences

subject: english
indicator: Identify end marks within sentences

subject: english
indicator: Identify and differentiate singular & plural nouns

subject: english
standard: Students use writing (print and graphic) to communicate with a variety of audiences for different purposes, adapting the form and content of their writing in order to express opinions, demonstrate understanding of the information they are learning, and convey real and imagined experiences and events.
objective: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose non-fiction texts.
subobjective: State what they are writing about.
indicator: Draw pictures of their favorite book, places, thing, or person

subject: english
subobjective: Supply some information about the topic.
indicator: Write about their favorite book, place, things, or person

subject: english
indicator: Do a show and tell on particular topic

subject: english
standard: Students use a variety of primary (i.e., maps, artifacts, visual materials, music, sound recordings, oral history, interviews) and secondary resources (e.g., libraries, databases, computer networks, video) to build knowledge on a subject through research projects and to respond analytically to literary and informational sources.
objective: Participate in shared research and writing projects.
subobjective: Explore a number of books by a favorite author and express opinions about them using sentence frames such as, My favorite book is - by - because -.
indicator: Draw a classroom map

subject: english
indicator: Present a class presentation

subject: english
indicator: Draw picture of favorite author

subject: english
indicator: Design and create a class collage

subject: english
indicator: Complete sentence frames with pictures

subject: english
standard: Students develop an understanding of and respect for diversity in language use and patterns (e.g. Palauan) as they make use of their first language to develop competency in English.
objective: Use knowledge of L1 nouns (singular, plural, common, proper, concrete, abstract) and verbs (action, helping) to understand English equivalents.
indicator: Identify singular and plural nouns.

subject: english
indicator: Categorize common and proper nouns

subject: english
indicator: Draw pictures of various nouns

subject: english
standard: Students participate as knowledgeable, reflective, creative, and critical members of a variety of literacy communities.
objective: Listen and respond to each other’s oral stories and give feedback.
indicator: Draw a picture and tell about it through a presentation

subject: english
indicator: Draw pictures showing the sequence of a story (beginning, middle and end.)

subject: english
indicator: Orally retell story in their own words

subject: english
indicator: Ask and answer questions to clarify the main point of a story
